name: Baked Mustard-Herb Chicken Legs
description: “A model of simplicity” is how Mark Bittman described this 2004 recipe from the San Francisco chef Gary Danko. Painted with mustard and tossed in an herbed mix of bread crumbs, they go right into an oven, to be pulled out about 30 minutes later. It’s dinner party-worthy fare, made just as easily on a weeknight.
keywords: bread crumbs, chicken legs, dijon mustard, fresh herbs, poultry, main course
recipeIngredient: 4 leg-thigh chicken pieces, cut in 2, or 8 thighs
1 teaspoon chopped fresh tarragon or other herb

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oven to 400 degrees. Trim excess skin and fat from chicken. Combine bread crumbs, garlic, parsley, tarragon and salt and pepper on a plate or waxed paper. Use a pastry brush to paint mustard lightly on chicken legs. Carefully coat chicken legs with bread crumb mixture.
Gently place chicken in a roasting pan and bake for 30 to 40 minutes, or until completely cooked. Serve hot or cold.
